------------------------------------ Meaning of each piece of information ------------------------------------
MODE=ECB
Encrypt each block independently

PAD=PKCS7
Padding in PKCS#7 format

BLKSIZE=8
IDEA block size: 8 bytes

NZ=2
When a 128-bit IDEA key is divided into eight 16-bit words, only two of them are non-zero.

BITS_PER_WORD=10
When dividing a 128-bit IDEA key into eight 16-bit words, the NZ non-zero words can only have a 10-bit range of values.

POS_DOMAIN=0,3,5
When a 128-bit IDEA key is divided into eight 16-bit words, the only candidate positions where non-zero values can be obtained are words 0, 3, and 5.

PROBE0_P
0x0000000000000000

PROBE0_C
The result of encrypting the block with IDEA-ECB using the key

PROBE1_P
0xffffffffffffffff

PROBE1_C
The result of encrypting the block with IDEA-ECB using the key

C_FLAG
The result of IDEA-ECB encryption with the entire flag as the key
